name: Mac OS X Sparse Image
summary: Learn about .SPARSEIMAGE files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: To create a sparse image file, click the "New Image" button in Disk Utility. Then choose "sparse disk image" from the Image Format dropdown menu.
NOTE: Apple's FileVault feature initially used encrypted sparse image files to secure a user's home directory. Newer versions of FileVault use the .SPARSEBUNDLE format.
